name: St. Raphael Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: St. Raphael was our first stop on our tour of the UK. The room was clean, bright, and airy. The perfect place for adjusting to our new time zone. The guest house is on a quiet street but only a short walk through a pretty park to the hustle and bustle that is downtown York.
reviews.title: Clean, bright, and airy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Les was a gracious hostess and more than happy to provide assistance when asked. We recommend that you follow her dining recommendations as the choices can be overwhelming if this is your first trip to York. Also recommend the railway museum. There's no better value for the money, especially since most of it is free!
reviews.title: Like mother - like daughter

reviews.text: This was our second visit to York and we had no hesitation at re-booking St. Raphael after our first visit there last year. Only change was Al and Les were no longer there but handed over to their lovely daughter Zoe and her partner Dom. They were just as welcoming as their mum & dad and provided the same excellence service throughout. Bedroom was immaculate, the whole place was spotless, the breakfast was un-faultable..freshly made bread, fresh fruit, wide choice of cereals, yogurts, jams, honey, fruit juice, full english, tea, coffee...what more can anyone want????
reviews.title: Different Proprietors, Same Excellence

reviews.text: Zoe and Dom make time to chat to you and offer any advise should you require it, a truly lovely couple. When we return to York we will not hesitate to return here, unless they are fully booked of course! and then it would be over to mum & dads place.
reviews.title: Look no further

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gary & Lynda
reviews.title: Fabulous but small

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently visited York, and stopped at St Raphael Guest House for 3 nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic place to stop

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The guest house was situated only a short walk from York City Centre and was in easy reach of the train station.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic...........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Guest house was great. The room was really clean with an extremely comfy bed and nicely decorated. We were made to feel very welcome on arrival and appreciated the tea and cake after our journey.
reviews.title: Wonderful

likes.liked: — Well run, spotless, great position and local knowledge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious with a good selection of cereals and a really good fruit salad, the fresh homemade bread was lovely as was the Full English cooked breakfast for which vegetarians are well catered for.
reviews.title: Superb Accommodation

reviews.text: Zoe and Dom were extremely friendly and the brochure written by them suggesting places to visit, eat and drink was very useful.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Zoe and Dom are a couple who welcome you into their home on arrival.It is the friendliest and cleanest place we have stayed at in over 40 years of travelling!
reviews.title: Fantastic Guest House!

likes.liked: — the friendly staff and the cleanliness

reviews.title: Treated like royalty
reviews.text: 5 star breakfast is served with warm home made bread and freshly prepared fruit salad.
Excellant personnal touches such as tea/coffee and cake when you arrive and fresh flowers in all rooms.
reviews.title: Loved St Raphael Guest House york

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellant stay and we will be back!!
reviews.title: The best B&B I've stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lucky enough to get a spot at the St. Raphael during a busy horse race weekend, and it was one of the best experiences on our entire trip. Les was accommodating of our slightly off-schedule arrival time and sent clear instructions of how to get into the property - where there was a lovely welcome package waiting for us.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked after reading the reviews. All of the previous comments are fully deserved. The only problem that i can see is getting booked, so do us all a favour dont tell anyone else about this lovely guest house so we can keep it too ourselves. A really big thank you to Zoe and Dom.
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven

reviews.text: My husband and I have been regularly visiting our daughter who is studying at York St John's University and have stayed in a variety of hotels and guest houses during this time. We came upon St Raphael by chance and can honestly say it's the best!! We only spent one night here but will definitely be back . I concur completely with everything that's been said in previous reviews in praise of the welcoming and friendly hosts, the spotless accommodation, fantastic breakfast (esp fruit salad and freshly baked bread), it's proximity to York city centre and the extra special touches such as fresh flowers, information pack and lovely toiletries in the room. A lovely place to stay.
reviews.title: We wish we had found this wonderful B and B three years ago!

reviews.text: The last overnight accommodation during our nine day holiday around the Isle of Man, Cumbria and Yorkshire. St. Raphael Guest House was perfect, clean and peaceful but very close to the city center and York's ghosts. And the breakfast, indeed, it was absolutely the best we had during our holiday.
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation

reviews.text: Cheers,
reviews.title: Thoroughly recommend....

reviews.text: Family Leinonen from Finland
reviews.title: Very Friendly, Very Clean, Very Convenient,

aka: St. Raphael Guest House Hotel York
description: 7 Bedroom Guest House set 400 yards from York Minster, free parking and wi-fi included. All rooms with shower en-suites. Fresh flowers in every room, home made bread baked every morning. Quiet residential cu-de-sac in the heart of the city. Within 10 mins walk to The Theatre Royal , Railway museum, The Shambles, The Art Gallery, and all of Yorks restaurants bars and pubs.
